website_summaries.verdict: This solid, durable tower is easy to assemble and is especially good for upper body work.
pros: Stations for vertical knee raises, push-ups, multi-grip pull-ups and dips
Measures 57" L x 41" W x 84" H
cons: To avoid frustration while assembling, do not tighten the nuts until everything is in place

customer_reviews.title: Good, good, good!
customer_reviews.text: Package was arrived in time (with messages that it would be late)), packing had good quality. Assembly was not hard because of good manual and pictures. It is stylish and has good quality. It fits even low ceiling of our basement. And it is good for big boys like my husband!!! Husband is happy!!! P.S. We could compare because tried to buy similar item from another seller last year, but it arived in damaged condition twice!!! Because of very bad packing. This seller takes care about good packing and already makes first steps of assembly. So, thank you and five stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: High Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Good choice for the home gym. You cant expect it to compare to professional grade equipment at the gym. But for the price point this is a very good choice. Im 6 ft 1, 200 lbs and it has held up with no problems. I use it almost every day. Assembly was quick and it feels very solid. Would def buy again. Update: Sept 2019, still loving it. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Warning, this box will piss off whoever delivers it to you. The box is well over 100 lbs. I put it together in about 45 mins. Having a drill to tighten everything once it's all in place will help. Very sturdy. Of course if you're stupid and try to use momentum in your exercises, then yeah it's going to wobble. But you should go for steady movement and good form anyway. Good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This product is an absolute waste of money. The arm pads are completely worthless, only being secured by two small screws that loosen after your first workout. I even tried duct taping towels around them and its still impossible to find balance. The whole product overall is extremely wobbly. I tried a few 75lb sandbags draped across the bottom but it had little effect. I also had to tape up all the handles because the plastic caps at the end will cut into your hands. Extremely disappointed in this piece of equipment from Golds Gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight so it's easy to move if necessary
customer_reviews.text: One of my most used pieces of equipment. Allows me to work nearly every muscle. Lightweight so it's easy to move if necessary. Instructions are very straightforward so it took minimal time and tools to put together. Definitely recommend if you're trying to do lots of body-weight exercises considering you can do it all with this one piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Let me start with the Assembly and wobbly part.. The wobbly part, it holds fine! If your not used to doing pull ups that can be why some people posted that it is to shaky. That could also be because it wasn’t put together properly. As a nutritionist / bodybuilding/ personal trainer it works great,, and highly recommend it for anyone getting started in the gym or looking to exercise in general. Good form on pull ups makes a difference. If you’re new to exercise get someone to help, if you can’t put stuff together get someone to help. Just posting the truth . I hope I’m not offending anyone. I’m 6-2. 200 pounds and holds me great.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works for the most part but worried about stability
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit worried about this product's stability. I've assembled it exactly as instructed but when using it I can feel it lift a bit off of the other side. This is for both the pull up bar side and the dip station side. Using it for leg/knee lifts is fairly stable although the pads are a bit off in their positioning for my comfort. FWIW, I am not a heavy person at less than 170 lbs. So you may want to consider a different product or some sand bags/weight bags to hold it down. It's a too big a pain in the butt for me to disassemble and return but I hope this helps others.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from Gold Gym because I trust the product name. Once the item was delivered, I realized that I had definitely made the right choice. This Power Tower is solid. It is made of steel, not an inferior metal that may bend easily or sway when being used. My husband who is 5'10" and 220 lbs has used it, and it does not bend or shake at all. Other reviews of similar items noted that their towers (not Gold Gym) would bend or sway. Again, no movement or weakness at all. I love this exercise tower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Assembly instructions are well laid out and assembly is easy for anyone who is somewhat handy with tools. Power Tower is sturdy and the pull up bar is a lot higher than my old door frame pull up bar. I do notice that the leg lift end will come up slightly if I get aggressive with my pull-ups but that's probably true with any Power Tower where the pull up bar is behind the frame like this one is. The only issue I had was that the back rest pad had a 2" tear where it was damaged in shipping - I contacted Gold's Gym and they promptly sent me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money - will do the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with a pull up assist strap to do a particular workout routine. The item arrived well-boxed and without any noticeable damage. I put this together by myself in about an hour. It is fairly sturdy but I would say that if you are over 200 lbs it will seem like it rocks when you are using the pull-up portion of the tower. Overall it is a 4 star items, it will do the job it is designed for in most circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: NateW

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Managed to put it together myself in about 2 1/2 hours. Supports my 140 lbs well, whether I use the pullup bar or dip bars, though it does flex the contraption a bit. Still, pullup bar supports my 180lb friend well, though he hasn't tried the dip bars so can't tell you about that. Sturdy build, use it a lot, good foam wrap-around to cushion palms, though as with any pullup bar, you will probably develop calluses. Great if you don't want to use a doorway type, and love those dip bars and the cushion to lean your back against for leg raises.
customer_reviews.author: Yosef Polinsky

customer_reviews.title: $89 is a steal! Buy two! These are amazing to have.
customer_reviews.text: If you are over 200 lbs. you will have to reinforce this bad boy if you swing on it. Otherwise DON’T SWING on it and don’t have your kids swing on it and it will be just fine! $89 is worth it! This thing is amazing for abdominal workouts and dips. Not to mention you get a pull up / chin up bar too! Aaaaand handles to assist your keyboard warrior hands with pushups! What more could you ask for?!!!!!! It’s amazing for $89!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Owen Owen's.

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine; one thing to keep in mind...
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and feels pretty sturdy. However, pay attention to its height and make sure you have the clearance to install it. I use an old manufactured home (single-wide trailer) for a gym, and this would not fit! It is too tall. I believe the single-wide has 7' walls. Ended up putting it in my actual house with standard 8' walls. In any case, it was my fault for not reading more carefully, so I didn't subtract any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good Product..BUT.. missing a grip on the pullup bar..
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product for the price. But had a grip missing on the pull up bar which makes it very uncomfortable due to the different sizes in the grip of the hand, and hand slips of easily. would have given a 5 star if everything was intact. Tried calling manufacturer to see if they could send me an extra grip to put on but after 3 different calls on wait times over 30 min. could not stay on hold any longer. Need some better quality control on checking items before packaging I think.. I attached a pic of with and without grip.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The gym is a perfect fit for the space
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out well for our backyard use. The gym is a perfect fit for the space. You do need over 7 feet of clear space when doing pullups. the only gripe, and not too serious, is that it's sitting a little uneven on the hard concrete surface despite taking all precautions during assembly. But we've been able to stabilize it with pieces of rug etc, and it really is useful for the entire family.
customer_reviews.author: SanjivM

customer_reviews.title: misleading product
customer_reviews.text: misleading product like the xrs20 weight bench, you wont get a golds gym logo, you'll get a proform xr 10.9, looks like a knock-off with no logo, looks like these companies are selling product based on misleading you with a golds gym logo, also damaged....not sure if it was when the delivery driver let it freefall at the bottom of my short flight of steps (we have him on camera) but none the less its damaged.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Nice Study Product and Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give myself the convenience of working out at times when I wanted and not having to leave the house. It is very study and the powder coating is firm on the metal parts. The grips and cushions are well made and it assembled easily. It would be difficult to tip, so I have felt very comfortable using it as directed. Everyone in the household is satisfied and finds it handy for a minutes at any time the pass. I would recommend this device. I have bought others and returned them, this is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to put together however my box was damaged a bit which resulted in me having to match up a couple of bolts at the local big box store. The tower is a great addition to my home gym and I use it everyday. I am 6’3” and 218 pounds. It is sturdy however, it rocks a little when I do dips on it but not with pull ups or leg raises. All in all, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Antonius H.

customer_reviews.title: UNSTABLE AND DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS THING!!! IT WOBBLES AND IS VERY FLIMSY AND NOW I HAVE 4 STAPLES IN MY HEAD FROM IT FALLING OVER ON ME WHILE DOING PULL-UPS. AND IM ONLY 140lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Malik

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product .
customer_reviews.text: This Power Tower was delivered fast And was very easy to assemble . Very Sturdy Equipment , I built it for my son who is about 162 lbs . Carries his weight great with Pull up bar , but when he does dips it tends to wobble a little but we put exercise mats under the Tower so it keeps it pretty level and it doesn’t wobble as much . I would recommend putting gym/garage floor mats under the Tower to level it off , with the mats underneath it is very stable and doesn’t move . This is a great quality product from Golds Gym .
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great product
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! The packaging was great and so were the instructions. I researched power towers for a week and I’m glad I picked the right one. This is so sturdy! I feel completely comfortable with any workout on it. The reviews that say it’s not sturdy don’t know how to do the workout properly... any power tower can be wobbly if you swing from it like an 8 year old. Great product start to finish, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this!! It took 2 people ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this!! It took 2 people an hour or so to put together. The box it came in was damaged but everything was in the box and and there was no damage to the item. He is 16 yrs old, 6'1" and weighs 170lbs While doing pull ups it does rock slightly so in the future I might buy some sand bags to put over the feet. It's well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Trauma Mama

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyers note that it may take a couple of hours to assemble it. The item comes with no tools and has lots of parts to assemble. My item came in a damaged box and one of the parts got bended so now my chin up bar is tilted to the left because the power tower’s left pole is slightly bended. I am now 40 minutes on the phone trying to reach out to the seller through amazon support. What a waste of the Amazon’s customer support and my time!
customer_reviews.author: Champo

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty usable
customer_reviews.text: Thing is pretty solid, although the slightest uneveness under it will get you to rocking doing chinups. The dip handles can be felt flexing a bit in use, which makes sense considering how much leverage you have on them. The piece of equipment is unbranded, even though i ordered a golds gym branded thing, but whatever. The pullup bar could stand to be 6-12 inches higher, so you dont need to bend your knees at the bottom of your rep ( im 6ft 0in). Overall very usable for the price, 4/5. Will edit if it suddenly breaks or something.
customer_reviews.author: Eddyruoke

customer_reviews.title: for men or larger, wider people
customer_reviews.text: This would be amazing IF it wasn't so wide. I'm 5'4" and I love using power towers in the gym but they are built not as wide as this brand. The only way for me to fix it is to take the 2 pieces a part, cut them down and reweld them to be the width I need. The current width actually causes pain and injuries as it's unnatural to have my arms out so wide. Too hard to return so now I'm stuck with it. :(
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly, unstable and downright dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It looks good but is not functional. It wobbles and feels like it is going to topple over with me on it, regardless of whether i am doing pull ups or dips. It is going back for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gorgijanidze

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Give it six stars for value if I could. I’m six foot and the pull up bar is the perfect height. The kid uses it to for his weird gymnastic stuff. Nice and stable but easy enough to slide out of the way. Assembly took about an hour using a socket set
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day, twice a day.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction. It wobbles when I do dips but it's got more to do with my muscular stability rather than the tower's. I think if it was sitting on those gym floor pads there's be no wobbling even with me on it. Had no issue putting it together. Instructions were clear. I'd advise you to pay close attention to orientation of pieces, I had to disassemble a portion to correct my mistake later.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic thank you
customer_reviews.text: Loving this thing. It’s lighter than I thought it would be. I’m appalled at stupid people’s comments in the reviews. Almost did not but this because of some of the reviews. Went together great. Moves easily into a corner. I’m 6’4” and it works fine. All stations on it are perfect. Started with this at 240 now I’m 200. Just want to say excellent addition to any home gym
customer_reviews.author: Aethric

customer_reviews.title: It went together well and is sturdy. However
customer_reviews.text: It went together well and is sturdy. However, the proportions of it just feel off. I tried a couple different models in stores and loved them, and I thought they were all the same so I bought this one to save some money. It just doesn't fit my body right. The arm rest are too high and the backrest is too low. The cushions are thick and padded, but that isn't necessarily a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Would Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was hoping for... I'm average height and weight, and it's very sturdy for me. I browsed several models in local sporting good stores, and they tended to be wobbly and uncomfortable. This one's perfect. FYI, for all the reviewers complaining about damage to the box and thus missing pieces/instructions, please note that this is a SELLER ISSUE, not a product issue. I got mine from a good seller (C&M Trade: 98% positive out of 6,382 reviews), and the box was undamaged and everything intact. Choose a good seller, and you won't have anything to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Blair

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Put it together by myself in about an hour. They only give you exact number of bolts and nuts so if any are missing you will need to get some from a store. Very solid. Elbow pads are cheaply made and may not last very long. Son has been using pullup bar every day.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Well made and worth it!
customer_reviews.text: What a well made sturdy unit, in a separate purchase I bought some heavy elastic bands and I'M GONNA GET MY PULLUP BACK THAT TIME STOLE FROM ME!!!!!!! Also enjoying a very impact way to work on the abs and core through the leg ups function that this thing has!!! Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phil

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My 77 year old friend asked me to help him find something he could do pull-ups on. I ordered this unit based on price and reviews. I exceeded my expectations by 100%. Easy to assemble. He immediately did 3 pull-ups, 5 chin-ups, 2 dips and 10 pushups. He is thrilled. I will order one for myself for Christmas 🎄
customer_reviews.author: ilania fowler-hughes

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment but parts all scratched up
customer_reviews.text: Equipment is good, but the actually parts were damaged when I got it and some pieces were really scratched up. Disappointed, especially considering this is going to be kept indoors. Will reach out to seller to see what they can do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: need better product control
customer_reviews.text: pull up bar was miss measured only 1 screw can install. Base tubes do not weigh enough makes tower unstable. I weigh 230. FEELS UNSAFE!!! exterior coating was not fully cleaned from either inside or outside before shipping very dirty to unpackage and assemble. Feels low quality. Not well thought out. FIX GOLDSGYM.COM WEBSITE ADD CRYPTO ALGORITHMS THAT USE SHA256+. SHA(SHA1) IS A BROKEN ALGORITHM (ie NOT SECURE)!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tecKDude

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Piece of Gym Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Very nice piece of exercise equipment, especially for the price. Easy to assemble as long as you have the correct tools. Make sure you know the dimensions of your room you intend on placing it. Has a great quality feel. Very happy with this addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use if you're Henry Cejudo, not so safe for Stipe Miocic
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'7 and weigh 155. I cannot imagine a middle weight or heavy weight being able to use it because it isn't very large and it moves when I do pull ups on it. Having said that, I love it! It's fairly easy to assemble and gets the job done! Just don't buy this if you are Stipe Miocic size, you will end up knocking it over like he did to his opponent in his recent fight!
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up, and move around! I am 5'4" 150lbs, husband 6'3" 230+lbs works for the both of us! This makes working out fun, it feels like an adult jungle gym! This product has helped us both with back as well as hip pain! Great investment for rebuilding back and hip muscles!
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Good Dimensions
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old son who is 5'11" and in lean great shape really enjoys using it and uses it apt on days he can't get to the health club. Only issue is the pads on the arms for the abs workout area are misplaced and make that area fairly unusable for me ...too far forward (I'm 5'3")
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Great product, push floor bolts ALL the way in on step 1
customer_reviews.text: Great product for its price! Be sure to have the very bottom bolts in all the way in their groove. i had it all together but i didnt realize the bolts have a indent they slide into. Had to tip the whole thing over to get them right.
customer_reviews.author: christian heil

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking specifically for the ability to do pullups and bar dips at home, so this seemed to fit the bill quite nicely. Having read other reviews, I was concerned about the quality but couldn't find anything truly competing with it for the price, so went ahead and ordered it. The Tower I received assembled easily, and is sturdy for the price. Used it about a dozen times now and am quite pleased. I am 6' 2" and about 175 lbs. I honestly cannot think of a complaint or concern. The Power Tower really is a fantastic value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: GetMerked

customer_reviews.title: Not worth hassle
customer_reviews.text: Game with base broken and missing serial number, so registration becomes impossible on website form. Calling the Amazon listed hotline is worthless as well, because if you don't fill out web form, they won't speak to you. 2 hours later and I'm frustrated enough to throw this equipment and the name Gold's Gym into the trash. Sometimes the price is too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste M. Stoltze

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars all around
customer_reviews.text: This item is a great value for the money I paid for it. I am a bit unsatisfied with the packaging of the product, however. The box came mangled and seemed to have been taped up after being opened. Some of the pieces came I severely scratched but I had only found that out after assembly and was not going to take it apart to return. It is a bit wobbly when you are performing dips but the wobble is manageable. Minus the presentation and aesthetic of some of the pieces in the box, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Amaro

customer_reviews.title: Better for a bigger framed person not good for small women
customer_reviews.text: Husband feels it is good fit for his body size (6 ft 200lbs), me, the wife, I feel the frame is way too wide for the average female (5'5" 127lbs). The arm pads for you elbows and forearms along with the joystick handles are set way too wide for me to comfortably use. Also the foot steps are set to far forward so if you want to do alternating leg windmills over a vertical foam roller you end up kicking the steps. Would have returned if it was not so large and needing to be disassembled
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Good all around unit but needs adjustment allowances in hardware
customer_reviews.text: We’ll build structure, but feel the ergonomics of unit are for someone as y’all and wide as a tank. My wife can’t use the knee up part of unit as it spreads her elbows out too far.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Quality Quality Quality
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old son loves this. Very stable and fantastic quality. Would definitely buy it again but wont have to because of the great quality. Very easy to assemble did it by myself.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great choice for a power tower! Sturdy, well built, stable, nice size! Back pad is in good position and it’s a nice size to support the back Works great for my husband who is 5’10” and 185 lb.
customer_reviews.author: Puffrider

customer_reviews.title: Good product but had sand in tubes...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was fairly easy, used a drill set on a lower torque setting to tighten everything once it was together like another reviewer said. It is very sturdy but not for those weird cross fit people who kick their legs all over like a dying fish. If you have good form it does not wobble at all. The dip bars could stand to be a bit thicker, but overall it's well made. My only complaint is one of the upper supports and the t bar were full of sand, which dumped out all over my floor when unpacking it which was really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Money

customer_reviews.title: Torn up package and missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how to review this product. I received it very quick which is great. Unfortunately the box was all beat up and opened on both ends. It is missing th hardware and for all I know could be missing other parts. I’m not exactly happy about it because I was excited to add this into my work out routines but as of now I have no idea what steps to take to get my issues fixed
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DeJosia

customer_reviews.title: Good system for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was not too bad to put together. It took my son and I about an hour and 15 minutes. It is pretty sturdy and has worked well so far. The only complaint I have is that the arm rest pads don't seem to sit well on the bars when in use. They move a little from side to side. I am expecting that they will probably come off over time as it is used more frequently. Aside from that, it was very good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Great quality- use for calisthenics
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sturdy and east assembly. Surprised of the product size and quality. Definitely product to use at home If you are calisthenics beginner this is a way to go .
customer_reviews.author: Mirsad C.

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big man and very sturdy for me. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Gold's gym  POWA TOWA
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 45 minutes to throw together, super simple! After about 2 months it starts to creek and make some noise but just go through it again and snug up the bolts and it's good to go. Feels nice and sturdy on both sides. I weigh 150lbs and it has no problem at all. I feel perfect safe on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: They recommend 2 people to set up. I did it by myself still pretty easy. Works great and supports my current weight at 220 pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Barton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived earlier than expected. We went ahead and hired someone to come assemble it. It was a great addition to our new workout room. It was missing arm pads but customer service was so great and easy to work with. They were prompt in their responses and said they would ship some out once they became available. Overall great experience and I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Saqib Nayani

customer_reviews.title: Bad seller
customer_reviews.text: Poor communication with seller. Price seems to change daily. Not the best quality. I’d suggest lock tight for the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Pull ups
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. I didn’t put anything together in over 15 years . I start by only doing 1 pull up but I would do about 5 sets in the entire day. I had it for about 2 weeks and now I can do 3 sets 5 times... I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: kelvin

customer_reviews.title: Great for leg tucks and pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid set to work out on. I needed it most to practice leg tucks and it’s really good for that.
customer_reviews.author: malaika

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to get a quick workout in when I don’t have time for the gym. Assembly was maybe an hour by myself, easy and instructions are good. Very sturdy. I’m 6’1”, 240lbs. Doing dips, pull-ups and abs it’s very stable as long as it is on a flat surface and you’re using a smooth and controlled motion for the exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Cusher

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy? Yes.  Level? Not sure.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but takes time. Sturdy once finished. Not sure if mine is level; it wobbles, but is still fine for use.
customer_reviews.author: Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Great work out
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Great size and sturdiness. Even came with a work out guide. Perfect weight distribution so you don't have to worry about it tipping over. I've been using it for pull ups, push ups, and dips and I am seeing results fast.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Really good product at a great price- sturdy for 200 pound guy- not bad to put together either
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: design is good but the armrests are starting to become wobbly because ...
customer_reviews.text: Tower is very stiff, design is good but the armrests are starting to become wobbly because they are made out of cheap material. Would not recommend for an avid user.
customer_reviews.author: Jordi Brizuela

customer_reviews.title: Great station for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. I was a bit skeptical of the sturdiness but this piece is solid when assembled. I weight 220lbs and it has little to no give on any of the workout components. The arm cushions seem to be a little off but not enough to not be able to use them. Would highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DBulen

customer_reviews.title: Was Nervous.......
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous at first with the product and the shipping due to the mix reviews I've read, however I didn't have any issues with the shipping all parts were there and it took my husband maybe an hour if that to assemble everything together and it looks great! Its been over a month now since the purchase and I can say it was worth it, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Product had alot of dents and dings. One broken piece.
customer_reviews.text: When assembling product had a piece broken. Several dents and dings on product either from shipping or storage. Overall an ok experience.
customer_reviews.author: Stone

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, it has become something I use in every one of my routines .
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Packaging weak, product strong
customer_reviews.text: Box was moderately damaged and several pieces of assembly hardware were missing. Will make a quick trip to HD to replace but a bit inconvenient. Unit itself seems very sturdy and looks great. Overall not a negative experience.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Ralston

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design for Pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, but doing pull-ups can tip the unit over. Poor design - the unit needs longer support legs under the pull-up section. Workaround is to be very careful doing pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: K2

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot more sturdy that I expected
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot more sturdy that I expected. I weigh 165lbs so I was expecting some tipping over from other people's reviews, but I hang on it and do leg lifts from it just fine and it stays completely still.
customer_reviews.author: Solé

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Delivered timely, the instructions were simple, clear, all screws numbered and included in each step. Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble and Stable
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in one hour and sturdy enough for mine and my husband’s workout routine. Customer service was very responsive when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Only $100!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of equipment. And only $100!! Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad. A bit shaky
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad. A bit shaky. I wish they'd make it a sturdier. Assembly was easy. Mostly can be done by one person. Had my seven year old help me in couple of places.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Nemirovsky

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my home gym
customer_reviews.text: It is not the sturdiest piece of equipment, but I purchased this when it was on sale for $100 so I got a great deal. Took about 1 hour to assemble. I use this for dozens of different exercises. Follow me on Twitter @PietchTheoryPro to see the ways I use the Power Tower!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pietch

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good power tower for price. Under $120, I’ve got this in my garage, should last years, no weather elements, welds are solid.
customer_reviews.author: Fish-on!

customer_reviews.title: Aint no damn hardware,sitting for a month now and cant exercise!
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for 1 month tried contacting seller about the missing hardware to no avail.i read numerous reviewes about other people with the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Castruita

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice for a non commercial grade , mine is little twisted at the top , but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy workout equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of workout equipment. Glad I added to my gym!
customer_reviews.author: Tocs Eroom

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very good piece of equipment. I way 230 pounds, machine was stable during pull-ups and dips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No installation tool
customer_reviews.text: The product was deliver without any tool for the installation. I tried different ways but could not tighten those locknuts. There is plastic inside the locknuts and I dont know how to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really worth buying for the money
customer_reviews.text: Really nice machine, I put it together by myself in an hour. Tall and sturdy for the most part. I tightened everything as much as possible and still get a little wobble when doing dips but not bad at all. Pull ups are perfect with this. Overall good purchase for the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Things 2 know
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the basement or garage to get a good full body workout, all a man really needs is to pull&push his body weight and stabilize his core to be in good physical condition, highly recommend great value
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Titus

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Plenty of Excercises.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value, theres plenty of excercises that you can do with this set. Quality is pretty and sturdy for me, only gets wobbly when doing dips.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Clear assembly instructions. I'm 5'10" about 160lbs. This product feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: for my purpose works great
customer_reviews.text: A nice addition if you like to take a break from weights. These types of exercises will toughen you up....Great Value.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I’m 5’11 195 lbs and this is plenty stable for ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’11 195 lbs and this is plenty stable for me to use. It’s a little short so I have to keep my knees bent to not touch the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and it’s affordable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s tall so be sure you have sufficient ceiling height. The build quality is solid and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine Rourke

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, it is very stable and I feel safe using it.
customer_reviews.author: Red_ice

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Well made. Easily supports my 6'3" 240lb husband.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for the workouts intended but I have back issues from time to time so I really like to use it to hang from and decompress my spine when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, weight limit (no more than 200lbs)
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t get it if you’re over 200lbs but it’s a very good deal, easy to assemble and great for at home workouts
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our home gym and it's exactly what we were looking for. Great quality and looks nice with our other equipment. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality,easy to assemble,very sturdy. I am 230 lbs and feel safe using.
customer_reviews.author: alan reese

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: This tower is very sturdy and works as advertised. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Can be used for many at-home workouts. Very sturdy and easy to build. A good piece of equipment to use until the gyms reopen.
customer_reviews.author: George Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty easy to set up, great quality, I'm a beginner and need to work my way up to pull-ups and chin ups, but so far it's great for sit ups, stomach crunches and leg & calf lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Saul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: All the items came in the box to put it together and still standing.
customer_reviews.author: Life

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great item for a relatively small space needed. Would recommend a mat under it if on carpet. I have found a few other exercised are possible using this if you are creative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerp.barber.barber

product_meta.title: Gold's Gym XR 10.9 Power Tower
product_meta.description: Push, pull and lift your body to perfection with the Gold's Gym XR 10.9 Power Tower. The Vertical Knee Raise Station will help you add definition to your abs. The Push-Up Station has padded hand grips so you can stay comfortable while you work out. The Multi-Grip Pull-Up Station will help you build stronger arms and the Dip Station will work on your triceps, chest and shoulders for incredible upper-body strength.
feature_bullets: Vertical Knee Raise Station; Step up and discover your inner 6 pack with this comfortable Vertical Knee Raise station
Push Up Station; Get the most out of your push up workout with these padded, push up hand grips
Multi Grip Pull Up Station; Get a grip wide, narrow, side to side and build better, stronger arms with this Multi Grip Pull Up Station
Dip Station; Build triceps, chest and shoulder muscles along with incredible upper body strength

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
